acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was deposited by Clifton Waller Barrett on January 5, 1965, and changed to a gift on July 1, 1991.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of 29 items, chiefly correspondence and writings of Helen Hunt Jackson.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged in three series. Series I consists of manuscripts, Series II consists of letters, and Series III consists of a photograph.

did.unittitle: Series I: Manuscripts
Biographical sketch by Sarah Chauncey Woolsey (pen name, Susan Coolidge) [1885];
Poem: "Fra Luigi's Marriage" [1865 Dec 8];
Poem: "Did the Sky Shut?" n.d.;
Poem: "November" n.d.;
Parable: "The Magic Clocks" (Part I) n.d.;
Parable: "The Magic Clocks" (Part II) [1885] Aug 8;
Poem: "A Last Prayer" [signature pasted on] n.d.;
Poem: "The Cruise of the Ship Happy" n.d.;
Poem: "Danger" n.d.;
Series II: Letters
Helen Hunt Jackson to Josiah Gilbert Holland 1840 Sep 28;

scopecontent.p: Asks him to help persuade Scribner and Co. to publish her letters and sketches written during a year abroad.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to [Thomas] Niles 1871 Mar 2;

scopecontent.p: Mentions her review for Scribner's Monthly, suggests he reprint MacDonald's stories with illustrations, calls MacDonald "foremost story teller today."

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to [Alexander Wilson] Drake 1876 Apr 3;

scopecontent.p: Mentions weather in Colorado and photographs she has received, compliments Drake on his skill as an illustrator.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to [Thomas] Niles 1879 Apr 30;

scopecontent.p: Asks him to order books of [Thomas Gordon?] Hake for her, states she eagerly awaits his decision on the [Rucherts?] and that the author is very anxious to sell the poem.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Mr. Payne 1880 Dec 28;

scopecontent.p: Discusses sources of information on Indians and her own book on Indians to be published January 25.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Miss Houghton 1880 Dec 30;

scopecontent.p: Has received petition from Philadelphia and sends it on with this mail.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to [William Hayes] Ward 1881 May 2;

scopecontent.p: Asks whether her sonnet on the Shoshone Oath has ever been published in The Independent; she has sent it to Jeannette Leonard Gilder for her paper, The Critic.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Mr. [Henry Oscar?] Houghton [1881] Nov 4;

scopecontent.p: Wonders why the editor of Fair Newspaper omitted the heading she wrote for the poem, asks if she could be provided a list of all the poems she has written for Atlantic Monthly in the last ten years, wants to publish a volume of sonnets, illustrated, mentions [Thomas] Niles and [John Boyle?] O'Reilly.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Mr. Gardner 1881 Dec 12;

scopecontent.p: Asks him to get letter promised by Mr. King, which will introduce her to King's friend at Capistrano, mentions her sister, Mrs. Hunt.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Daniel Sharp Ford, in his guise as "Perry Mason" 1882 Jul 30;
Helen Hunt Jackson to Henry Chandler Bowen 1883 Sep 23;

scopecontent.p: Sends a series of papers on Southern California for publication in The Independent and discusses price, asks if he wants a series on Arizona and the Indians of Arizona, mentions Gen. [George] Crook and criticizes proofreader of "Pot of Gold."

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to William Winter 1884 Mar 19;

scopecontent.p: Compliments Winter on his poem "The Golden Silence," mentions that he has not answered her letters or visited, despite invitation.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Henry Chandler Bowen 1884 Apr 15;

scopecontent.p: Proposes to write for The Independent a series of papers pertaining to home life, discusses price, mentions St. Nicholas [children's magazine] and William Hayes Ward.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Henry Chandler Bowen 1884 Apr 16;

scopecontent.p: Defends price she charges for six essays on home life.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Henry Chandler Bowen 1884 Oct 15;

scopecontent.p: Encloses poem she has written about Indians starving on a reservation while there is an overabundance of wheat in the country, suggest it be published in The Independent, asks who is acting as editor.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Josiah Gilbert Holland n.y. Feb 6;

scopecontent.p: Expresses sorrow for a misunderstanding, surprised that he thinks she could afford to sell papers on Japan at the same price as ordinary papers, agrees not to tell others.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to [Robert Underwood] Johnson n.y. Mar 15;

scopecontent.p: Asks for two subscriptions to The World, for herself and Miss Banfield, asks if he would like her to write a notice of Mrs. Dodge's poems for Literary World.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to Moncure D. Conway n.d.;

scopecontent.p: Thanks for sermon, which she returns, having copied it, would like to make copies of the other two of the series.

did.unittitle: Helen Hunt Jackson to magazine editor n.d.;

scopecontent.p: Part of a longer letter, expresses anger that he published an article she wanted destroyed.
